intro: Psychotria vololoniaina, commonly known as the Madagascar psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, red berries that are typically eaten by birds, aiding in seed dispersal. Psychotria vololoniaina is often found in moist, shaded habitats within the rainforests of Madagascar.
